Travis, for sure, Liam, Laura, Taliesin's on here, Denise, Amandine's on here, Eddie, Max, and Sam-- times when I think about Critical Role and my Critical Role family, a single trait sticks out in my mind: their kindness.
For instance, they were kind enough to offer me this job by sending a courier to my house to hand-deliver me a note.
Surely, they must have been overwhelmed with work, auditions, parenting, and insurance fraud-- Sam.

No, I mean, there's only eight of them.
Did we really send a courier?
I took it as an act of kindness.
That evening, at dusk, I sat in front of my house, holding that note, almost afraid of its contents.
There, among the stray cats and drifters, I finally gathered the strength to read that note.
I held it close to the barrel fire I had just cooked my dinner over, and I opened the note.
The first thing I noticed was it was quite short.
The second thing I noticed about this note offering me the job was that it wasn't even handwritten.
